statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Massachusetts 72, Richmond 56
article.story: AMHERST, Mass. (AP) -- Chris Lowe scored 19 points as Massachusetts shook off a bumpy first half in a 72-56 victory over Richmond on Saturday. Lowe led a trio of UMass double-digit scorers. Gary Forbes had 16 points and Rashaun Freeman added 13. The Minutemen (16-6, 6-2 Atlantic 10) trailed 31-30 at halftime but started the second half with baskets by Stephane Lasme and Freeman and a pair of free throws by James Life. Richmond (5-17, 1-8 A-10) didn't get its first basket of the second half until nearly seven minutes had expired. The first half was a game of runs, with Richmond using a 12-0 spurt to go on top 23-14. UMass bounced back with a 10-0 streak to take the lead, 24-23. Richmond managed its one-point halftime margin on a jumper by Jarhon Giddings just before the buzzer. David Gonzalvez led the Spiders with 15 points. Brian Morris scored 11. The Minutemen made 33 of 43 from the foul line, compared to Richmond's 13-for-18. Freeman had nine of his points before the break, with UMass showing an 18-8 rebounding edge.
